page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: These 12 square kilometers of South Warwickshire have been surveyed by the children of Dunnington Primary School directed by Mrs A. Howell, class teacher. The area lies some 20 miles south of Birmingham. The nearest town is Alcester. Evesham is 6 miles to the south, and Stratford-on-Avon some 8 miles to the east. The area consists of the village of Dunnington, and the hamlets of Cock Bevington, Wood Bevington and Iron Cross. The area itself is one primarily of fruit growing and market gardening. In recent years, the marketing of crops has been supplemented by a system of 'Pick Your Own', whereby customers pick their own fruit and vegetables. Many of the houses were part of the Ragley Estate and were tied cottages; some mentioned in the first Domesday Book.
